name: Radisson Blu Alcron Hotel, Prague

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006
reviews.text: This was a much better place than it looked at first impressions. The rooms were well equiped and comfortable, though yes, they are European sized not American. The service was excellent, but what really surprised me was the restaurants. We had the gourmet seafood menu at the more upmarket of the two restaurants, and it truly was one of the top few meals I'd had - and I get to eat at many fine places through my job. I could also recommend the Sunday brunch.
reviews.title: A great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled solo
reviews.text: Downsides: the central location and proximity to the Irish bar up the road means that there is some noise, especially at weekends, but even at the front it did not become a problem.
reviews.title: Great Service in a city that doesn't know service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: Would return again, and recommend it.
reviews.title: Good, not Great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a great time at the Radisson. Very good location. Nice service and beautiful lobby. Room was spacious and comfortable, and the bathroom was new. The pseudo air conditioning in the room was no where near enough for the heat in Prague in August, but Europeans refuse to embrace the A/C concept- even in 2006. One great story- the guest before me had filled up several of the water bottles in the minibar with tap water and recapped them. I pointed this out to the reception on my way to dinner. By the time I returned, there were two large bottles of water waiting for me in the room compliments of the hotel. That's the way it should be. I'd stay here again.
reviews.title: Really nice, but not 5 star!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lobby was very nice, the food in the bar was excellent. The hotel's car service was reasonable and convenient. The rooms, while nicely equipped, were small, even for Europe. The distance between the foot of the bed and the dresser was so small I couldn't open the drawers all the way and had trouble walking by (and I'm not a large person by far). I found the bed to be very hard and found it difficult to sleep. No view whatsoever, which didn't particularly bother me. It seems from reading other reviews that the club level rooms are far superior to the regular rooms. Since we had our adult sons with us, we needed 2 rooms and didn't want to pay for the higher level, but found the regular room to be not quite as nice as expected. Air conditioning was barely adequate, but I'm used to the strong A/C we have in New York, so overall we found most air conditioning in Europe to be not quite up to par. Service was good; we didn't have time to eat the breakfast, so we can't comment on the restaurant food. The location is excellent, and Prague is a lovely city, easy to get around and quite interesting.
reviews.title: Just Satisfactory

likes.disliked: — Service and our small, hot room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the SAS Alcron for 5 nights this month. The room was clean and spacious. The bathroom was good sized and the shower was high pressured and hot!
reviews.title: Great stay at the SAS Alcron
Beautiful City
reviews.text: This is a beautiful hotel (inside) and we loved the service and art deco style. The original marble staircase is great. The concierges were very helpful. We upgraded to the Royal Club room. This got us access to the business lounge that had free internet (one terminal) and free coffee/juice and pastries. The upgrade inlcuded breakfast at the hotel restaurant - which was very good. Lots of options for food and drink at the breakfast buffet.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only negative was that the sheets and towels were not soft or of high quality. Perhaps this is the case in general in Prague. We were happy though, because we got a lot for our money.
reviews.title: Exellent and romantic
Id recomend this to anybody
reviews.text: We gladly recommend this hotel to anyone.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here as part of a group of eight (four couples) for a long weekend. Hotel was fine, but have to admit I was expecting more from the room for a five star hotel.
reviews.title: Outstanding, exellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: This was a business stopover that turned into a superb stay. The room, the restaurant, the breakfast were all without fault.
reviews.title: Superb stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This is the type of hotel I would highly recommended after a few days business - up the country. Thanks
reviews.title: What an excellent Hotel! Could not have been better!!

likes.liked: — Pristine clean rooms, great food and fantastic location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even before arriving at this hotel the service was superb in that they arranged a car and the BEST driver to meet us at the airport (with a sign with our name on it which is always a sight for sore eyes after long international flights). The cost was for the transfer was 35% leass than a taxi and the driver gave us so much information along the way and pointed out the hightlight views along the way so it was just about like having an evening tour as well. Rooms (we had 2 for our group of 3) were well appointed and very large. Always nice to have that huge deep bath for a soak to relax. The location could not have been better to walk to all of the main sights, the buffet breakfast was absolutely the best I have ever had and the staff were friendly and accomodating. Having the chance to meet the hotel Manager Michel Chour told us why every one wirking their is so inspired to do thier best. We will definately be back!
reviews.title: one little niggle....but very good

likes.disliked: — paying for tea and coffee in my room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great hotel. I'd stayed before whilst on business, so knew what to expect. I took my wife on a leisure trip and it was as good as I remembered. Rooms lovely, standards of service, facilities excellent, as was the location.
reviews.title: Absolutely Magnificent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: I have one very small complaint. This is a five star hotel, but charges for tea and coffee you make in the room. I didn't realise I was being charged for this and when I checked out, my coffee bill was higher than my bar bill !..... to be charged £4 per coffee that I made myself in my room seemed a bit excessive and mean.... (?) apparently it is stated on the mini bar price list...but we didn't have one in our room, and I never use the mini bar anyway. so wouldn't have seen it...
reviews.title: Fantastic stay at the Radisson Alcron, Praha

likes.liked: — The service.Everyone was warm and accomodating.
likes.disliked: — Erm..can't think of any faults really....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had the best ever stay over Christmas - my best advice is to book a Royal club room - you get a really high floor, lovely large bedroom, robes, slippers, a la carte breakfast etc - worth the upgrade (booked via expedia). I totally disagree with comment that it was not 5 star my experience was 5 star all the way - we only ever stay @ 4 or 5 star hotels (I love being pampered so much I'd rather stop at home if we can't afford it!) and this was definitely one of the best hotels I have stayed at.
reviews.title: Absolutely Fantastic!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I actually thought the fitness room large and well equipt for a city hotel. Staff were charming - nothing was too much trouble and we found the bar inexpensive for a hotel bar. Restaurant was nice too but the manager was a bit snooty (all the table staff were great though and very knowledgeable on wines)
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great restaurant round the corner on Wencelas Square called HOT.
reviews.title: loved Alcron

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: We stayed 6 days and it was the best value luxury experience I have ever had - when I couldn't get into a nail shop the concierge sorted it for me!
reviews.title: Excellent and central
Lovely Art Deco Hotel
reviews.text: Wouldn't stay anywhere else in Prague - so central for everything but not noisy - felt totally pampered and rested.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Like Rocketman77, I couldn't find a starwood hotel that would be open until 2009 so we booked the Radisson SAS Alcron. After spending 600 euros per night and being severly disappointed at the Hyatt Kiev(please read my 1/5 rated review if Trip advisor ever decides to post it), we were apprehensive about what we would receive for less that 300 euros per night.
reviews.title: Best hotel on the planet with regards to value and luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: WHAT A WONDERFUL SURPRISE. HEAVEN. Beautiful, well appointed room and huge in comparison with the Hyatt. An exceptionally huge breakfast buffet that is included in the room rate. Free pay per view and music channels and are you ready for this?????????????Free mini bar with champagne, shots, beer, VOSS water, snacks, etc. The service was exceptional. we had dinner at the ALCRON restaurant on our last night. We were served by two friendly and efficient waiters, the food was exceptional and hearty, the presentation superb.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay in Prague

likes.liked: — The staff, room, location and amenities.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed the Radisson SAS ALCRON. I travel abroad 4 times a year and this hotel, by far, is number one with regards to value, service, location, the list goes on.
reviews.title: Quality Hotel
Very good choice in Prague
reviews.text: Thank you Radisson SAS Alcron. I plan to go to Paris/London and I will take some cooking classes that you offer at your hotel and of course, I will be staying with your hotel and no other,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: your loyal guest
reviews.title: Fine hotel - Prague.....................??

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I traveled to Prague on my way to Munich and stayed at the hotel for one night on October 2008. I was traveling with my partner who is a deaf and sight-impaired person.
reviews.title: the best place to stay in Prague

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at the Radisson for only one night, but it is an experience not to be forgotten. From the very beginning when making the reservation continuing with check in and check out. All the staff was wonderful and willing to assist at all times, even when there was a big group that had just entered the hotel. The "breakfast to go" was a real treat too.
reviews.title: Highly recommended hotel

likes.liked: — Location of hotel, quality of rooms and food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Of course we will be most happy to be guests again in this hotel.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: This hotel is an excellent choice for a short stay in Prague. We looked at many other high class hotels there before making our choice and we were delighted with our choice.
reviews.title: Plush hotel in Prague

likes.liked: — plush bed and clean, marble bathroom
likes.disliked: — half glass shower door that flooded the floor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is spotlessly clean, the staff are very friendly. Rooms are very well equipped, modern and spaceous even with a travel cot in the room! The beds are so comfortable. We asked for a quiet room so we had a view of the tops of the roofs at the back of the hotel but this was unimportant to us as our sleep was more precious! Some of our party had rooms at the front with a small terrace which they enjoyed during the day, but they did suffer sleep deprivation when large groups of singing lads left the irish bar a few doors up late at night! The bathrooms are lovely - marble, modern, and spotlessly clean, the only downside is the shower screen isn't big enough to retain the water from a power shower so the floor can end up soaked when you shower!
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this break as an "away time hol" for us adults only. We can only write as we found - great location, incredible hotel with fantastic breakfasts. Prague is a lovely city with all sights in walking distance. The restaurants we found were varied and all enjoyable - you could eat as cheap as chips or eat like a king, dependant on your budget and preferences. Coming from Scotland we found the temperature in Prague very very mild and our only complaint (if it is a complaint) was that our room was warm as well, and we concur with other comments on this site that the hotel needs to look at its air con system. Having said all that, since returning we have recomended this hotel and we would certainly return.
reviews.title: Mum & Dad away time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: We (couple with 2 small children)stayed at the radisson in prague for 3 nights in october. When we checked in we expected we were being given a large triple room, as booked but when we went in it was a average size room with a small extra bed for my daughter and really no place for a cot. Going back to the reception the lady told us "we have nothing called triple room in the hotel "which is what we had booked on the internet after they could not guarantee us connecting rooms bet ween us and the kids. So. after a lot of arguing we got ourselfs a large room which was lovely and when the concierge brought our luggage to the room i asked him what the new room was called and he said "triple /large room". Anyways the room was lovely so we enjoyed the rest of our stay. The breakfast was well laid out with a lot of choice. They could have just given us the big room in the first place and made it better for us. However the location is very central and overall a nice hotel.
reviews.title: good hotel

likes.disliked: — some of the front desk staff very unfriendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for two nights at the end of October 2006. Ate four meals: lunch at Alcron restaurant, breakfast buffet at La Rotonde, and room service breakfast. All meals were outstanding, the service impeccable, the cleanliness without fault (I struggled to find a spot or water mark anywhere in the bathroom). When I ordered room service, the meal was brought within ten minutes. I've stayed in hundreds of luxury hotels around the world and this place holds its own.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel!

likes.disliked: — No view as it's on a city street

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel for two nights at the end of August. As I stayed in the business class room I had some extra goodies - like breakfast in the room, free movies, free paper etc. I visit Prague quite often and I have to say that this hotel exceeded all my hopes - it was simply excellent. The room was beautiful, had a nice balcony. Service was everything you would expect from a 5 star hotel and more - starting from the check it, room service til my transfer to the airport. Location - perfect, close to everything yet on a rather quiet street. I am a very frequent visitor to Prague and I have stayed in a number of upscale hotels - this hotel gets my highest marks for sure. Thank you very much for a wonderful stay and if not before I will stay with you again at the end of November. děkuji!!!
reviews.title: In my opinion - the best hotel in Prague

likes.liked: — Nice room. good food , great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we both stayed for my husband birthday and got a room upgrade and we apprieciated the lovely touches like the chocolates and the sparkling wine.and flowers. The hotel is in an excellent location within walking distance to everything. The staff were super and the bedroom was so comfortable and had everything you need. The breakfast was fantastic everything you need. We had a meal at the alron which was excellent aswell. We also liked the beboop bar with jazz playing in the background. I thought it was a good idea that the hotel car takes you back to the airport. Prague is a magical city and will stay at the radisson again in the future in prague
reviews.title: loved the hotel
Loved my stay at the Raddison,The Hotel was over its standards!!!
reviews.text: We stayed at the Raddison on the 22nd of August 08 for 3 nights, I really enjoyed the short break it was so relaxing.The hotel is located just 5 mins from wenceslas square and 10 mins from Old town. There is plenty to do, this ranges from shopping,excursions and more shopping. There is plenty of restaurants to choose from, there is a irish pub right next door to the hotel, which was really nice especially if you like sport because they show all the footie games. We didnt eat in the hotel, so I cannot comment on that. Prague is like a mini London, if you have been there. There are a couple of clubs & bars, but you just need to find them because they are not situated together. The hotel room was lovely, we were on the 8th floor so we got quite a nice view from our room, I liked the fact that there was music in the bathroom I thought that was different.There was also a mini bar, flat screen plasma TV, cofee making facilites and a lovely comfortable king size bed. I have also got to say that the maids were brill, they cleaned our room every day and that you should visit Charles Bridge which is about a 10 mins walk and you will see some lovely scenery this is a must do!. I would def stay at this hotel again, thanks Raddison for a brilliant stay!!! I hope this will help you on by choosing this hotel, you will not be disappointed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006
reviews.text: Sarah
reviews.title: Incredible Hotel in an equally incredible city!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: London
reviews.title: Fantastic service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arriving in the Czech Republic from a four day bender at the Radisson SAS in Amsterdam, we were very excited to take in the beautiful sights of Prague in the summertime.
reviews.title: Top Notch and just off Wencelas Square

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We emailed the concierge a week before our arrival to arrange transport from the airport (at a nominal fee) and had a brand new mercedes waiting for us once we checked out bags. It was very painless and we were impressed at the excellent english that was returned to us in our correspondence.
reviews.title: 1930's grandeur - definitely top end.

aka: Radisson Blu Alcron Hotel, Prague Hotel Prague
description: The Alcron is ideally located in the heart of the cultural, historical, shopping and business areas. In May 2008 all 206 guest rooms were refurbished in the Art Deco style to reflect the ambiance of a bygone era while including all modern conveniences and unsurpassed amenities. Exquisite dining opportunities in two award-winning restaurants and live music programs ensure that your stay will be memorable.
